lyrics.text: First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: How many people visited the great exhibition of 1851?
lyrics.translation: 有多少人参观了1851年的盛大展览？

lyrics.text: Perhaps the most extraordinary building of the 19th century was the Crystal Palace, which was built in Hyde Park for the great exhibition of 1851.
lyrics.translation: 也许19世纪最非凡的建筑是水晶宫，它是为了1851年的伟大展览而建在海德公园的。

lyrics.text: The Crystal Palace was different from all other buildings in the world, for it was made of iron and glass.
lyrics.translation: 水晶宫与世界上所有其他建筑不同，因为它是由铁和玻璃制成的。

lyrics.text: It was one of the biggest buildings of all time and a lot of people from many countries came to see it.
lyrics.translation: 这是有史以来最大的建筑之一，许多来自不同国家的人都来参观它。

lyrics.text: A great many goods were sent to the exhibition from various parts of the world.
lyrics.translation: 来自世界各地的许多商品被送往展览会。

lyrics.text: There was also a great deal of machinery on display.
lyrics.translation: 展览上也展出了许多机械。

lyrics.text: The most wonderful piece of machinery on show was Naznith's steam hammer.
lyrics.translation: 展出的最精彩的机械是纳兹尼思的蒸汽锤。

lyrics.text: Though in those days traveling was not as easy as it is today, steamboats carried thousands of visitors across the channel from Europe.
lyrics.translation: 尽管在那些日子里旅行并不像今天这么容易，但汽船还是从欧洲运送了成千上万的游客穿过海峡。

lyrics.text: On arriving in England, they were taken to the Crystal Palace by train.
lyrics.translation: 一到英国，他们就乘火车被带到水晶宫。

lyrics.text: There were six million visitors in all and the profits from the exhibition were used to build museums and colleges.
lyrics.translation: 总共有六百万游客，展览的利润被用来建造博物馆和学院。

lyrics.text: Later, the Crystal Palace was moved to South London.
lyrics.translation: 后来，水晶宫被迁移到了伦敦南部。

lyrics.text: It remained one of the most famous buildings in the world until it was burnt down in 1936.
lyrics.translation: 直到1936年被烧毁，它一直是世界上最著名的建筑之一。
